        <p class="site-description">
          Lee Kuan Yew was born on 16 September 1923 at 92 Kampong Java Road, a
          two-story house. The road was named for the Javanese community known
          for their gardening and horse-tending skills.
        </p>
      </div>

        <p class="site-description">
          Founded in 1845, Chui Huay Lim Club, initially the Teochew
          Gentlemen's Club, is one of Singapore's oldest clubs. It served as
          a central hub for the Teochew community, promoting unity and strength.
        </p>

            Hooper, once housed former Singapore President S.R. Nathan.
